pages.text: Wands are simple to operate. Many, but not all, have two functions. The primary function is cast upon right-clicking while holding the wand. The secondary function is cast upon shift-right-clicking while holding the wand.

Wands have a chance to fail. I seem to have no control over the failure rate, but I do seem to be able to cast the wand a few times before it fails. Upon failing, the wand breaks completely, vanishing from existence.

$(item)Wand Powder $()is the primary fuel required for casting wands. Wand powder can be crafted using some natural and magical components. I simply need to have the powder in my inventory, or in a $(item)Wand Powder Pouch $() when casting a wand.

$(item)Wand Powder $()is the primary fuel for casting wands. I must have sufficient powder in my inventory or in a $(item)Wand Powder Pouch $()when casting a wand. Powder is crafted by tossing a $(item)Magic Blend $(), made from magical components, into a cauldron of $(item)Lunar Water$().
By combining quintessence, mushrooms, luminescent dusts, and vis specks, I can create a magic blend, capable of being imbued with moonlight.
By immersing this mixture in lunar water, I can create powders imbued with the power of the moon; enough to fuel magic wands.

A $(item)Wand Powder Pouch $() can hold $(item)Wand Powder. $()This should make it easier to carry around fuel needed to cast my wands. To store powder, I just need to right-click the pouch while I have powder in my inventory. Shift-right-clicking will remove powder from the pouch.
